introduction.p: Sage is a powerful OpenSource system with the goal of being a viable alternative to Magma, Mathematica, Maple, and Matlab. In this initial chapter we will consider how to get up and running with SageMath.
There are several approaches to using Sage Math:

li.p: Downloading the source and running locally.
using SageMath Cells embedded in your own web documents
Installing Android or iOS Apps on your phone or tablet.

introduction.p: We will now look at some of these methods.

section.title: SageMath Online
section.p: Probably the easiest way to familiarise yourself with SageMath is to use a Sage Math Cloud Server. From the main SageMath page select the Sage Online link. You will have to set up an account but these are free for basic usage.
Once you have set up an account you can then create a project and a SageMath Worksheet. There are full instructions here Logging On.
